intro: Stevia lucida var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf stevia, is a perennial shrub native to South America. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are typically broad and have a serrated edge. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It is well-known for its high concentration of steviol glycosides, which are natural sweeteners. This variety is often cultivated for both ornamental purposes and as a source of natural sweeteners.
